meta.content: â€‹April 20, 2020 Hello Legacy Parents, Great News! Beginning this Friday, April 24, our Friday pick-up meals will also include breakfast and lunch for Saturday and Sunday for students and siblings,...

div.div:
â€‹April 20, 2020
Hello Legacy Parents,
Great News! Beginning this Friday, April 24, our Friday pick-up meals will also include breakfast and lunch for Saturday and Sunday for students and siblings, ages 1-18! So, for example, if youâ€™re picking up meals for three children on Friday, you also will receive breakfast and lunch for each of them for Saturday and Sunday.
Directions for reheating will be included in the weekend meals as hot meals will be on the menu those days as well. Lunch entrees will come with a milk and either a fruit, veggie, chips or cookies. Breakfast comes with a box of cereal or a cereal bar, fruit and milk.
Â
Remember, the meals are free for all students and siblings, ages 1-18. Meals can be picked up Monday-Friday from 10:30 am to Noon while supplies last. Children do NOT need to be with you in order to receive their meals. If youâ€™re unable to pick up the meals, your students can pick them up if they can safely walk, or ride their bikes, scooters or skateboards to school, and you have given them permission to do so.
Â
Weâ€™re thankful to our cafÃ© manager and staff for extending the free meals to the weekend. This is an additional offering theyâ€™re thrilled to provide as weâ€™ve heard over and over again what a great help these meals are to so many of our families.
Â
We look forward to continuing to see you and your students at meal pick-up time!
Â
Take care,
Â
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School District #478
Â
************************************************************************************
20 de abril de 2020
Hola padres
Â¡Una gran noticia! Â¡A partir de este viernes 24 de abril, nuestras comidas de recogida del viernes tambiÃ©n incluirÃ¡n desayuno y almuerzo los sÃ¡bados y domingos para estudiantes y hermanos de 1 a 18 aÃ±os! Entonces, por ejemplo, si estÃ¡ recogiendo comidas para tres niÃ±os el viernes, tambiÃ©n recibirÃ¡ desayuno y almuerzo para cada uno de ellos el sÃ¡bado y el domingo.
Las instrucciones para el recalentamiento se incluirÃ¡n en las comidas de fin de semana, ya que las comidas calientes tambiÃ©n estarÃ¡n en el menÃº esos dÃ­as. Las entradas para el almuerzo vendrÃ¡n con leche y frutas, verduras, papas fritas o galletas. El desayuno viene con una caja de cereal o una barra de cereal, fruta y leche.
Recuerde, las comidas son gratuitas para todos los estudiantes y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os. Las comidas se pueden recoger de lunes a viernes de 10:30 a.m. a mediodÃ­a hasta agotar existencias. Los niÃ±os NO necesitan estar con usted para recibir sus comidas. Si no puede recoger las comidas, sus estudiantes pueden recogerlas si pueden caminar con seguridad o andar en bicicleta, patinetas o patinetas a la escuela, y usted les ha dado permiso para hacerlo.
Agradecemos al gerente y al personal de nuestro cafÃ© por extender las comidas gratis hasta el fin de semana. Esta es una oferta adicional que estÃ¡n encantados de ofrecer, ya que hemos escuchado una y otra vez la gran ayuda que estas comidas son para muchas de nuestras familias.
Â¡Esperamos seguir viÃ©ndote a ti y a tus estudiantes a la hora de recoger la comida!
CuÃ­date,
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrador
Legacy Charter School District # 478

br.br:
Hello Legacy Parents â€“
As we end this first week of remote learning and move into the next, I want to thank you â€“ I couldnâ€™t be prouder of the partnership between our teachers and parents! What is occurring to help keep Harbor learning happening remotely is amazing. Everyoneâ€™s efforts are appreciated.
Here are a few reminders as we go into week two:
nÂ Â We have carefully sterilized the school and packed up studentsâ€™ desks, placing their personal items in individual bags, along with other items they will need going forward. (School employees have worn masks and gloves, and followed other health protocols in order to do this work safely.)Â Beginning Monday, April 20, from 8 a.m. to Noon,Â parents may pick up their studentsâ€™ bagsÂ by driving up to the front of the school where an employee runner will retrieve them from inside the school building and bring to your car.Â Thank you for following these strict guidelines ofÂ no entry into the school. Our purpose in doing so is to ensure everyoneâ€™s health and safety while keeping the school clean and sanitized.
Â
nÂ Â If your childâ€™s teacher has communicated with you that he or she will have learning packets to pick up at the school,Â those packets will continue to be distributed outside of the school building with the help of a school aide.Â Therefore, you will not enter the school building to receive your childâ€™s packet.
Â
nÂ Â The free meal pick up for students and siblings, ages 1-18, has been great! Keep coming by to pick up their breakfasts & lunches and to say â€˜hi. We appreciate being able to stay connected in this way with parents and students. The pick-up time for meals is 10:30 am to Noon, Monday-Friday. Again,Â please stay in your car (and please have children remain in your car as well). We will bring the meals to you.Â Students and siblings do not have to be with you in order to pick up their meals. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. If students have your permission, they can walk, or ride their bikes, scooters, or skateboards to school to pick up meals.
We wish that the school was full of students and teachers going about their normal routine. But until that time returns, we will embrace this altered learning approach and make it the best it can be for students.
Thank you, and continue to stay safe and well.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School District #478
***********************************************************************************Â
17 de abril de 2020
Â
Hola padres heredados -
Â
Al finalizar esta primera semana de aprendizaje remoto y pasar a la siguiente, quiero agradecerles: Â¡no podrÃ­a estar mÃ¡s orgulloso de la asociaciÃ³n entre nuestros maestros y padres! Lo que estÃ¡ ocurriendo para ayudar a mantener el aprendizaje de Harbor sucediendo de forma remota es increÃ­ble. Los esfuerzos de todos son apreciados.
Â
AquÃ­ hay algunos recordatorios a medida que avanzamos en la segunda semana:
Â
nÂ Â Hemos esterilizado cuidadosamente la escuela y empacado los escritorios de los estudiantes, colocando sus artÃ­culos personales en bolsas individuales, junto con otros artÃ­culos que necesitarÃ¡n en el futuro. (Los empleados de la escuela usaron mÃ¡scaras y guantes, y siguieron otros protocolos de salud para hacer este trabajo de manera segura.)Â A partir del lunes 20 de abril, de 8 am a mediodÃ­a, los padres pueden recoger las maletas de sus estudiantes conduciendo hasta el frente de la escuela donde un corredor empleado los recuperarÃ¡ del interior del edificio escolar y los llevarÃ¡ a su automÃ³vil. Gracias por seguir estas estrictas pautas de no ingresar a la escuela.Â Nuestro propÃ³sito al hacerlo es garantizar la salud y la seguridad de todos al tiempo que mantenemos la escuela limpia y desinfectada.
Â
nÂ Â Si el maestro de su hijo se ha comunicado con usted que tendrÃ¡ paquetes de aprendizaje para recoger en la escuela,Â esos paquetes continuarÃ¡n siendo distribuidos fuera del edificio escolar con la ayuda de un ayudante escolar.Â Por lo tanto, no ingresarÃ¡ al edificio de la escuela para recibir el paquete de su hijo.
Â
nÂ Â Â¡La comida gratis recogida para estudiantes y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os, ha sido genial! Sigue viniendo para recoger sus desayunos y almuerzos y para decir hola. Apreciamos poder estar conectados de esta manera con padres y estudiantes. El horario de recogida para las comidas es de 10:30 a.m. a mediodÃ­a, de lunes a viernes.Â Nuevamente, quÃ©dese en su automÃ³vil (y haga que los niÃ±os tambiÃ©n permanezcan en su automÃ³vil). Le traeremos las comidas.Â Los estudiantes y hermanos no tienen que estar con usted para recoger sus comidas. Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Si los estudiantes tienen su permiso, pueden caminar o andar en bicicleta, patineta o patineta a la escuela para recoger las comidas.
Â
Deseamos que la escuela estÃ© llena de estudiantes y maestros que siguen su rutina normal. Pero hasta que regrese ese tiempo, adoptaremos este enfoque de aprendizaje alterado y lo haremos lo mejor posible para los estudiantes.
Â
Gracias, y continÃºe manteniÃ©ndose seguro y bien.
Â
Sr. Seth Stallcop
Administrador
Legacy Charter School District # 478
April 13, 2020
Hello Parents!
Â
We had a great, first day providing the breakfast & lunch combo meals for pick-up at the school! Thanks to everyone who came. Weâ€™re looking forward to continuing this service and seeing even more of you take part!
Â
Remember, your student(s) and siblings, ages 1-18, do NOT need to be with you to receive their meals and the meals areÂ FREEÂ for every child. If youâ€™re unable to pick up meals, but your students are able to walk or ride their bikes to school (and you have given them permission to do so), they can pick up them up. The meals can be picked up Monday-Friday from 10:30 am to Noon.
Â
And these lunches arenâ€™t peanut butter and jelly sandwiches! Rather, theyâ€™re exactly what would be served if it were lunch time in the school building. Therefore, hereâ€™s the upcoming menu:
Â
4/14...Chicken nuggets
4/15...Corn dogs
4/16...Rippers
4/17...Nachos
Â
4/20...Personal pan pizza
4/21...tangerine chicken rice bowl
4/22...Chicken Burger
4/23...Crispitos
4/24...Hamburgers and fries
Â
4/27...Rippers
4/28...Popcorn chicken
4/29...Hamburger and fries
4/30...Nachos
5/1.....French toast sticks and sausage
Â
5/4.....Chicken Tenders
5/5.....Build a sandwich
5/6.....Chicken nuggets
5/7.....Chicken fried steak (potatoes and gravy)
5/8.....Chefs choice
Â All lunch entrees come with a milk and either a fruit, veggie, chips or cookies. Breakfast comes with a box of cereal or a cereal bar, fruit and milk.
Â
Thank you for your support as we get this meal combo pick-up program underway. If your students would like to make signs to hang out your car windows saying â€˜hi to their teachers, EAs, principal, or friends, have them bring those along and weâ€™ll do our best to take pictures & videos to post on the schoolâ€™s website and social media!
Â
We look forward to seeing you tomorrow and in the days ahead!
Â
Â
13 de abril de 2020
Â
Hola padres
Â
Â¡Tuvimos un gran primer dÃ­a brindando las comidas combinadas de desayuno y almuerzo para recoger en la escuela! Gracias a todos los que vinieron. Â¡Esperamos continuar este servicio y ver a mÃ¡s de ustedes participar!
Â
Â Recuerde, su (s) estudiante (s) y hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os de edad, NO necesitan estar con usted para recibir sus comidas y las comidas son GRATUITAS para cada niÃ±o. Si no puede recoger las comidas, pero sus estudiantes pueden caminar o andar en bicicleta a la escuela (y usted les ha dado permiso para hacerlo), pueden recogerlas. Las comidas se pueden recoger de lunes a viernes de 10:30 a.m. a mediodÃ­a.
Â
Â¡Y estos almuerzos no son sÃ¡ndwiches de mantequilla de manÃ­ y mermelada! MÃ¡s bien, son exactamente lo que se servirÃ­a si fuera la hora del almuerzo en el edificio de la escuela. Por lo tanto, aquÃ­ estÃ¡ el prÃ³ximo menÃº:
Â
4/14 ... Nuggets de pollo
4/15 ... Perros de maÃ­z
4/16 ... Desgarradores
4/17 ... Nachos
Â
4/20 ... Pan personal pizza
4/21 ... tazÃ³n de arroz con pollo y mandarina
4/22 ... hamburguesa de pollo
4/23 ... Crispitos
4/24 ... Hamburguesas y papas fritas
Â Â
4/27 ... Desgarradores
4/28 ... pollo con palomitas de maÃ­z
4/29 ... hamburguesas y papas fritas
4/30 ... Nachos
5/1 ..... palitos de pan tostado francÃ©s y salchichas
Â
5/4 ..... Licitaciones de pollo
5/5 ..... Construye un sÃ¡ndwich
5/6 ..... Nuggets de pollo
5/7 ..... Filete de pollo frito (papas y salsa)
5/8 ..... ElecciÃ³n del chef
Todos los platos principales del almuerzo vienen con leche y frutas, verduras, papas fritas o galletas. El desayuno viene con una caja de cereal o una barra de cereal, fruta y leche.
Â
Gracias por su apoyo mientras ponemos en marcha este programa combinado de comidas. Si a sus estudiantes les gustarÃ­a hacer letreros para colgar las ventanas de su automÃ³vil y saludar a sus maestros, EA, director o amigos, pÃ­dales que los traigan y haremos todo lo posible para tomar fotos y videos para publicar en la escuela. sitio web y redes sociales!
Â
Â¡Esperamos verte maÃ±ana y en los prÃ³ximos dÃ­as!

div.strong: FREE Breakfast & Lunch for ALL Legacy Students & Siblings beginning April 13!
div.br:
Donâ€™t forget that beginningÂ Monday, April 13, FREE, cold breakfast and lunch combo mealsâ€¯for ALL Legacy students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at Legacy between 10:30 am â€“Noon while supplies last.Â Students and siblings do NOT need to be present in order for parents to pick up their meals.Â Please remember meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Thank you.
Â
Â¡Desayuno y almuerzo GRATIS para TODOS los estudiantes y hermanos heredados a partir del 13 de abril!
No olvide que a partir del lunes 13 de abril, las comidas combinadas GRATUITAS para el desayuno y el almuerzo frÃ­os para TODOS los estudiantes de Legacy y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os, estarÃ¡n disponibles todos los dÃ­as para recoger en la acera en Legacy entre las 10:30 a. M. Ãºltimo. Los estudiantes y hermanos NO necesitan estar presentes para que los padres puedan recoger sus comidas. Recuerde que las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Gracias.

State Department of Education Resources for Parents:Â Â https://www.sde.idaho.gov/parents-educators.html
Idaho State Coronavirus website:Â Â https://coronavirus.idaho.gov/
Tek-Hut - TEKFINITY OFFERS 30 DAYS FREE TO NEW CUSTOMERS, ADDS NEW STUDENT PACKAGE DURING CORONA VIRUS (COVID-19) CRISIS
Sparklight -Â SPARKLIGHT MAKES UNLIMITED DATA AVAILABLE ON ALL INTERNET PLANS FOR 30 DAYS, WAIVES LATE FEES FOR 60 DAYS DURING CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) CRISISÂ
Centurylink -Â Our Well-Being Focused Approach to care for people and our business amid COVID-19 (Coronavirus)
SCHOOL UPDATES
April 12, 2020
Hello Legacy Parents â€“
As we begin this first week in our distance learning format, there are a few items in which we need to be mindful to ensure the health and safety of our school community:
nÂ If your childâ€™s teacher has communicated with you that he or she will have learning packets for you to pick up at the school, please note that the packets will be distributed to you outside of the school building with the help of a school aide. Therefore, you will not enter the school building to receive your childâ€™s packet.
nÂ The same will occur for picking up student and sibling free breakfast and lunch combo, take-with-you meals. The pick-up time for the meals is 10:30 am to Noon, Monday-Friday. Please stay in your car (and please ensure any children with you remain in your car as well). When you are greeted by a school employee or principal, let them know the number of meals you need for your student(s) and siblings, ages 1-18, and he or she will retrieve them for you. (There might be a line, so please be patient with the school employee as she or he works to take care of each and every one of you.)
Following the above items will keep physical contact with each other to a minimum and within the parameters of Idahoâ€™s Stay-Home Order, especially ensuring no one enters the school building unless approved to do so.
Please know, too, that during this first week back we will carefully sterilize the school and pack up your studentâ€™s desk, placing their personal items in individual bags, along with other items they will need for week two and beyond. (School employees will wear masks and gloves to do this work.) Beginning Monday, April 20, from 8 a.m. to Noon, parents may pick up their studentâ€™s bag by driving up to the front of the school with an employee runner then retrieving your studentâ€™s bag from the school building and bringing it to your car.
Thank you for understanding the need to follow these strict guidelines of no entry into the school during this unprecedented time. Our purpose in doing so is to ensure everyoneâ€™s health and safety while also ensuring our school is clean, safe, and ready to go for when (hopefully) the Stay-Home Order is lifted.
There is nothing my teachers and I want more than to be in the classrooms with your students. It has been especially hard for us to accept that this wonâ€™t be the case come tomorrow. However, if we are diligent in following the items above, adhering to the Stateâ€™s Stay-Home Order, and doing our best to provide your students with a positive, distance-learning experience we hope weâ€™ll be together again sooner rather than later.
Thank you, and please keep watching your emails for continued communications.
Stay safe and well,
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School District #478
*****************************************************************************************************
12 de abril de 2020
Hola padres heredados -
Al comenzar esta primera semana en nuestro formato de aprendizaje a distancia, hay algunos elementos en los que debemos estar atentos para garantizar la salud y la seguridad de nuestra comunidad escolar:
nÂ Si el maestro de su hijo se ha comunicado con usted que tendrÃ¡ paquetes de aprendizaje para que recoja en la escuela, tenga en cuenta que los paquetes se le distribuirÃ¡n fuera del edificio escolar con la ayuda de un ayudante escolar. Por lo tanto, no ingresarÃ¡ al edificio de la escuela para recibir el paquete de su hijo.
nÂ Lo mismo ocurrirÃ¡ al recoger a los estudiantes y hermanos, desayuno y almuerzo combinados, comidas para llevar con usted. El horario de recogida para las comidas es de 10:30 a.m. a mediodÃ­a, de lunes a viernes. Por favor, quÃ©dese en su automÃ³vil (y asegÃºrese de que los niÃ±os con usted permanezcan tambiÃ©n en su automÃ³vil). Cuando sea recibido por un empleado o director de la escuela, hÃ¡gales saber la cantidad de comidas que necesita para su (s) estudiante (s) y hermanos (as), de 1 a 18 aÃ±os, y Ã©l o ella los recuperarÃ¡ por usted. (Puede haber una lÃ­nea, asÃ­ que tenga paciencia con el empleado de la escuela mientras trabaja para cuidar de todos y cada uno de ustedes).
El seguimiento de los elementos anteriores mantendrÃ¡ el contacto fÃ­sico entre ellos al mÃ­nimo y dentro de los parÃ¡metros de la Orden de permanencia en el hogar de Idaho, especialmente asegurando que nadie ingrese al edificio de la escuela a menos que estÃ© aprobado para hacerlo.
Tenga en cuenta tambiÃ©n que durante la primera semana de regreso esterilizaremos cuidadosamente la escuela y empacaremos el escritorio de su estudiante, colocando sus artÃ­culos personales en bolsas individuales, junto con otros artÃ­culos que necesitarÃ¡n para la segunda semana y mÃ¡s. (Los empleados de la escuela usarÃ¡n mÃ¡scaras y guantes para hacer este trabajo). A partir del lunes 20 de abril, de 8 am a mediodÃ­a, los padres pueden recoger la bolsa de su estudiante conduciendo hasta el frente de la escuela con un corredor empleado y luego recogiendo el de su estudiante. bolsa del edificio de la escuela y llevarla a su automÃ³vil.
Gracias por entender la necesidad de seguir estas estrictas pautas de no ingresar a la escuela durante este tiempo sin precedentes. Nuestro propÃ³sito al hacerlo es garantizar la salud y la seguridad de todos y, al mismo tiempo, garantizar que nuestra escuela estÃ© limpia, segura y lista para cuando (con suerte) se levante la Orden de quedarse en casa.
Mis profesores y yo no queremos nada mÃ¡s que estar en las aulas con sus alumnos. Ha sido especialmente difÃ­cil para nosotros aceptar que este no serÃ¡ el caso maÃ±ana. Sin embargo, si somos diligentes en seguir los puntos anteriores, cumplir con la Orden Estatal de Residencia y hacer todo lo posible para brindarles a sus estudiantes una experiencia positiva de aprendizaje a distancia, esperamos volver a estar juntos mÃ¡s pronto que tarde.
Gracias, y siga vigilando sus correos electrÃ³nicos para comunicaciones continuas.
Mantente seguro y bien
Sr. Seth Stallcop
Administrador
Legacy Charter School District # 478
April 8, 2020
Here is a link for a Schoology Tutorial that will assist both Parents and Students.Â
â€‹Schoology Tutorial
Please be aware that this was created for Victory Charter School and the site name will not be the same but the basic information will apply.
April 6, 2020
Dear Parents â€“ Hopefully, you all have had a chance to review the letter sent last Wednesday (below), but just to be safe, weâ€™re sending it again with a reminder to be on the look-out for an email from childâ€™s teacher this Wednesday, April 8.
Thank you.
******************************************************************************Â
March 31, 2020
Hello Parents of Legacy Students,
While we donâ€™t want to inundate you with communications during spring break, we do want to keep you informed as we know COVID-19 is presenting all of us with challenges we need to plan for sooner rather than later. This note is to provide an update on where weâ€™re heading in educating your students come Monday, April 13.
As we shared in the March 25 parent letter, we will employ distance learning beginning April 13. We are anticipating that distance learning will continue until the end of April. Thank you, again, for responding so quickly with information regarding your home wifi connectivity and availability of devices.
First, to hopefully help put your minds at ease, students will not be required to spend countless hours a day on a device, and their lessons will not be â€œlive.â€ In other words, your family should not need multiple devices in the home in order for your students to â€œattend school.â€ As a result, we will not need to provide a device for each student. However, for those who have shared that they have no devices at home, one will be provided. Our teachers are working incredibly hard preparing video lessons that can be watched at a times that work well for your family and takes into account more than one student in the home, and breaks them up in such a way that no student is sitting through lengthy lessons. Much like their regular classroom, your studentsâ€™ at-home learning will be broken up into short, learning chunks.
All total, students will have no more than 1-hour of videos to view per day. The videos will be coupled with assignments and homework that can be completed either on a device, or off it. For those who have shared with us that they have no wifi connectivity, you will be contacted (if you havenâ€™t already) to arrange an alternative educational approach. Some grades might have take-home packets with lessons and activities. If take-home packets are used, please know extra precautions in preparing them will be in place, including gloves being used to assemble the packets and separation of the packets for at least 48 hours when they are returned, among other safety measures.
Generally, our distance learning day will look like this: Video lessons for math, language, reading, and science (videos for math lessons will be posted Monday-Thursday; language, reading and science videos will be posted one day per week); assignments/homework similar to what they already do; a weekly assessment in math on Friday; and optional, additional learning activities for those families interested. The beautiful thing about posting videos, rather than hosting â€œliveâ€ learning sessions, is your students can watch their videos and review them as theyâ€™d like, or as needed. This approach takes our philosophy of, â€œIf you donâ€™t get it today, youâ€™ll get it tomorrow; if not tomorrow, then the next day, and so onâ€¦â€ and puts it into play in this distance learning format. We know youâ€™ll be surprised, if not amazed, watching your childâ€™s ability to continue to learn in the manner to which theyâ€™re accustomed (direct instruction/choral response), even in this video format. In fact, please encourage them to respond as they would if they were in class with their peers. We have no doubt you will be impressed at the pace of each lesson and the way in which your students respond. We hope it will provide you with what many parents say to us so often: that they wish they had a front-row seat to their childâ€™s school day. Come April 13, you will be involved in way that perhaps you havenâ€™t before by â€œattendingâ€ the videos with your children and being right there to encourage them as they work through a lesson.
Important things to know:
nÂ One of the most important things we want you to know is you will not have to present the lessons yourselves, or know the content before your children view their videos or work on their assignments/homework. In fact, in the videos teachers will use the â€œThink Aloudâ€ method whereby they will think out loud the concept being taught from start to finish so that their students can follow along with them as they work it through to completion. The teachers are going to great lengths to plan and present an at-home learning experience that is as close to their studentsâ€™ regular school day, but also manageable for a family.Â Â
nÂ Technology will be less than perfect. We understand and know that there will be technology glitches. Your home connectivity might be fine one day and struggle the next. The learning platform weâ€™ll be using might be slow one day, no response on another day, and fine the next. Please know we will work with you on technology issues. The numbers of school districts globally now forced to use an online form of education is staggering, so all schools and students will have issues at some point.Â
nÂ On April 8, you will receive an email from your childâ€™s teacher (if you have multiple students attending our school, you will receive an email from each of your childrenâ€™s teachers), sharing their expectations for their students, and detailing their educational plans for their class while providing you with your studentsâ€™ log-in information into Schoology, the learning platform to be used. While a fairly straight-forward, simple platform, the teachers will include in their letters a link to an online tutorial for you to view to familiarize yourselves with Schoology, if youâ€™re not already. Additionally, teachers will share the process for contacting them if you or your student is experiencing technical issues, how attendance will be taken, what will be graded, how to turn in homework and assignments, their teacher contact hours should you need to reach them, and how they will contact you if/when necessary.
nÂ Our school district has been approved as a site for picking up free meals beginning April 13. Free, cold breakfast and lunch combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am â€“Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site.
nÂ The first day back to school, but in this distance learning format, is Monday, April 13.
We continue to thank you for your support and willingness, using a phrase that works well with Harbor, to venture through these unchartered waters with us. As a Harbor school, your students have already been learning and achieving at an incredible pace in an educational environment that provides above-grade learning in a safe and kind culture. We know their learning will continue and that they will do their best to adapt to this temporary school format.
We canâ€™t wait to be back with your students in the school building. Until then, thank you for partnering with us to help ensure that they continue to excel. We will, in the days and weeks ahead, do our best to be our very best for your students, and weâ€™ll address issues that might come up with flexibility and positivity so we can model to them how to face tough situations well.
Above everything, please take care of yourselves, your children, and all those around you. We look forward to hearing your studentsâ€™ stories of success once weâ€™re back together.
All our best to you and your students,
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School District #478
Parent Letter - April 1, 2020
Please see attached documents on preparing for distance learning.
Thanks,
Legacy Charter School
Preparing for Distance Learning - English
Preparing for Distance Learning - Spanish
Breakfast & Lunch Meals Update â€“ April 1, 2020

Legacy Way, Nampa) between 10:30 am â€“Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Thank you.

Legacy Way, Nampa) entre las 10:30 a.m. y el mediodÃ­a hasta agotar existencias . Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Gracias.

ActualizaciÃ³n de comidas gratisÂ 13-17 de abrilÂ - Â¡Desayuno agregado!
En la carta a los padres que enviamos el 25 de marzo, compartimos que del 13 al 17 de abril, comidas combinadas gratuitas de almuerzo frÃ­o para estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os de edad, estarÃ¡n disponibles diariamente para que los recojan en la escuela en la escuela entre las 10:30 am - MediodÃ­a hasta agotar existencias.Â Â¡Estamos felices de decir que esto ahora incluirÃ¡ el desayuno!Â Recuerde que los niÃ±os deben estar presentes para recibir las comidas. Parent LetterÂ March 25, 2020
Parents â€“ Thank you for your quick replies to the email yesterday, March 24, regarding your home WIFI access. Weâ€™re receiving good information from you that is greatly helping us put in place what we now know will be the need to use remote learning our first week back from spring break, April 13-17.
More details will be coming regarding the approaches weâ€™ll use April 13-17 so you and your students can prepare. If youâ€™ve yet to reply to yesterdayâ€™s email, please do so as soon as possible, letting us know if you do not haveÂ WIFI access, and if you will have challenges in providing devices (i.e., PCs, laptops, etc.) for your students to use at home. Although, we have access to limited devices, we will try our best to provide those with no devices. Once this information is collected we will be able to determine the best arrangements for offering school attendance options to ensure our students are learning in the most effective ways possible.
Also, for April 13-17, free, cold-lunch combo meals for students and their siblings, ages 1-18, will be available daily for curbside pickup at the school between 10:30 am â€“Noon while supplies last. The meals are to be taken and not consumed on site. Children must be present to receive a free meal.Â
If you know of parents who might not be receiving these emails for some reason, please let us know, so we can contact them another way, or please ask them to call the school office. We want to make sure everyone is receiving these updates. The way in which our school community is coming together has been incredible and we appreciate all our efforts in helping each other. Thank you for your ongoing support.
We will keep updating you as we approach April 13, and we will be working with families individually as necessary to ensure all our students have access to their education that week. Please keep checking your email inbox, the school website and Facebook for information.
We continue to stay positive in our hopes you all are well and that tomorrow, the first day of spring break, is one you can enjoy among the uncertainties.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School #478

25 de marzo de 2020

Aunque, tenemos acceso a dispositivos limitados, haremos todo lo posible para proporcionar a los que no tienen dispositivos. Una vez que se recopile esta informaciÃ³n, podremos determinar los mejores arreglos para ofrecer opciones de asistencia a la escuela para asegurar que nuestros estudiantes estÃ©n aprendiendo de la manera mÃ¡s efectiva posible.
AdemÃ¡s, del 13 al 17 de abril, habrÃ¡ comidas combinadas gratuitas de almuerzo frÃ­o para estudiantes y sus hermanos, de 1 a 18 aÃ±os, disponibles diariamente para que los recojan en la escuela en la escuela entre las 10:30 a.m. y el mediodÃ­a hasta agotar existencias. Las comidas deben tomarse y no consumirse en el sitio. Los niÃ±os deben estar presentes para recibir una comida gratis.
Si conoce a los padres que podrÃ­an no estar recibiendo estos correos electrÃ³nicos por alguna razÃ³n, hÃ¡ganoslo saber para que podamos contactarlos de otra manera, o pÃ­dales que llamen a la oficina de la escuela. Queremos asegurarnos de que todos reciban estas actualizaciones. La forma en que nuestra comunidad escolar se ha unido ha sido increÃ­ble y apreciamos todos nuestros esfuerzos para ayudarnos mutuamente. Gracias por su continua ayuda.
Seguiremos actualizando a medida que nos acercamos al 13 de abril, y trabajaremos con las familias individualmente segÃºn sea necesario para asegurar que todos nuestros estudiantes tengan acceso a su educaciÃ³n esa semana. Siga revisando su bandeja de entrada de correo electrÃ³nico, el sitio web de la escuela y Facebook para obtener informaciÃ³n.
Seguimos siendo positivos con la esperanza de que todos estÃ©n bien y que maÃ±ana, el primer dÃ­a de las vacaciones de primavera, sea uno de los que pueda disfrutar entre las incertidumbres.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrador
Legacy Charter School #478
Coronavirus Parent Letter - 3-24-2020
â€‹
Hello Legacy Parents â€“ we wanted to touch base with you before we technically begin our scheduled spring break, which runs from March 26-April 10.
As we continue to work to stay ahead of the COVID-19 curve while following the directives by health officials, our Governor, and the State Board of Education, we are committed to maintaining our high standards of education and safety for your students. Realizing this might require an online component, depending on where things stand in a couple of weeks, we want to be as prepared as possible.
Therefore, we need your assistance by providing the following information to us as soon as possible:
If you doÂ notÂ have WIFI access at home, please reply toÂ office@legacycharterschool.netÂ saying so, making sure to include the names and grades of your students attending our school. While our teachers have a pretty good idea of which families might be without WIFI service, we want to do our best to confirm the information. Thank you for your quick replies.
We will remain in contact with you over spring break, so please be sure to check email often, as well as the schoolâ€™s website and social media.
Take care and stay well,
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Coronavirus Parent Letter - Shut down 3-16-2020
Legacy Charter closed March 17-April 10
To continue our efforts in being overly cautious while best serving our students, staff and families, the school will be closed effective tomorrow, March 17, and will remain closed through Friday, April 10.
Limited staff will be at the school March 17-20 and March 23-25 for parents and students to pick up personal belongings, etc., if needed.
While the school is closed, please continue practicing social distancing, practicing sound personal hygiene, and following the latest guidance from the CDC and Southwest District Health.
Thank you and take care. Looking forward to us all returning on April 13.
Mr. Seth Stallcop
Administrator
Legacy Charter School #478
Legacy Charter cerrado del 17 de marzo al 10 de abril
â€‹Para continuar nuestros esfuerzos de ser excesivamente cautelosos mientras servimos mejor a nuestros estudiantes, personal y familias, la escuela permanecerÃ¡ cerrada a partir del maÃ±ana 17 de marzo y permanecerÃ¡ cerrada hasta el viernes 10 de abril.
El personal limitado estarÃ¡ en la escuela del 17 al 20 de marzo y del 23 al 25 de marzo para que los padres y estudiantes recojan sus pertenencias personales, etc., si es necesario.
Mientras la escuela estÃ¡ cerrada, continÃºe practicando el distanciamiento social, practicando una higiene personal sÃ³lida y siguiendo las Ãºltimas pautas de los CDC y Southwest District Health.
Coronavirus Parent Letter - Shut down
Coronavrius Parent Letter - Shut down - Spanish
â€‹SPRING PARENT-TEACHER CONFERENCES CANCELLED
Parents â€“ Due to continuing concerns regarding Corornavirus/COVID-19 and our efforts toÂ prevent the introduction and spread of the virus in our school and among our families, spring parent-teacher conferences have beenÂ cancelled. If you have concerns regarding your student and would like to meet with her/his teacher(s) before the end of the school year, please contact the teacher to arrange a time to meet. Likewise, if there are students in which teachers are concerned, their parents will be contacted by the teacher. Thank you for your understanding and care as we continue to keep our school community safe and healthy.
